title: Website phone number link not opening dialer in Firefox (mobile)
content:
I have a WordPress website for a local service business, and the phone number is added as a clickable link using tel:.

Example page where this is happening: Check here

The phone link works correctly in Chrome and Safari, but on Firefox mobile the dialer doesn‚Äôt always open when I tap the number.

This is the format I‚Äôm using: tel:8774609961

Is this expected behavior in Firefox mobile, or is there a recommended way to format phone links so they work consistently across browsers?

Any help would be appreciated.
creator: ashevillejunkr

title: Non-removable settings? "English (GB)" language and "Autoplay -> "About:Welcome" -> "Allow Audio and Video"
content:
Hi,

Looking at my Firefox 147.0.1 settings for macOS 26.2 (Apple M1), I'm trying to adjust two settings:

-- I'd like to remove Languages -> English (GB) (its existence has odd side effects, like triggering United Airlines to offer fares in Pounds Sterling, and I'd prefer to just have English (US))

-- I'd like to disable Play Audio and Video for about:welcome (in regular and private windows)

I can see no way to accomplish this currently -- why?

Thanks.
